subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} – A hand holding a stone, referring to a man working with a stone axe.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*p/ba||male; father}}.

Regular development from Middle Chinese would lead to the labiodental ''fù'' in Mandarin, but the colloquial word resisted the sound changes and is now written as {{zh-l|爸}}, with the {{zh-l|巴}} phonetic component added to it to indicate the unchanged bilabial initial.
